title: The Comeback
fact: In 1993, the Buffalo Bills overcame a 32-point deficit against the Oilers in the playoffs to win 41-38 in overtime.

title: Rookie Surprise
fact: Dak Prescott threw 23 touchdowns and only 4 interceptions in his rookie season with the Cowboys in 2016.

title: Iron Man Streak
fact: Brett Favre started 297 consecutive regular season games at quarterback from 1992 to 2010.

title: Defensive Powerhouse
fact: The 2000 Baltimore Ravens allowed only 165 points all season, one of the best defensive performances in NFL history.

title: Perfect Draft Steal
fact: Tom Brady was selected 199th overall in the 2000 NFL Draft by the Patriots.

title: Historic Shutout
fact: In 1989, the Cleveland Browns shut out the Steelers 51-0 in Pittsburgh—the worst home loss in Steelers history.

title: Special Teams Glory
fact: Devin Hester returned 20 kicks/punts for touchdowns during his career, electrifying fans nearly every season.

title: Low Scoring Battle
fact: Super Bowl LIII between the Patriots and Rams ended 13-3, the lowest scoring Super Bowl ever.

title: The Immaculate Reception
fact: Franco Harris made the 'Immaculate Reception' in 1972, a miraculous play that helped launch the Steelers dynasty.

title: Longest Field Goal
fact: In 2021, Justin Tucker nailed a 66-yard field goal to beat the Lions as time expired.

title: Monday Night Miracle
fact: In 2000, the Jets overcame a 30-7 deficit in the 4th quarter against the Dolphins to win 40-37 in overtime.

title: Snowplow Game
fact: In 1982, the Patriots beat the Dolphins 3-0 in a snowy game where a snowplow cleared a spot for the game-winning field goal.

title: The Fog Bowl
fact: The 1988 playoff game between the Eagles and Bears was so foggy in the second half that fans and players could barely see.

title: The Minneapolis Miracle
fact: In 2018, Stefon Diggs caught a last-second 61-yard TD pass to beat the Saints in the playoffs.

title: The Music City Miracle
fact: In 2000, the Titans won a playoff game against the Bills on a last-second lateral kick return.

title: Unstoppable Rookie
fact: Randy Moss set a rookie record with 17 TD catches in 1998.

title: Mr. Consistency
fact: Jerry Rice had 11 straight seasons (1986-1996) with over 1,000 receiving yards.

title: Dual-Threat QB
fact: Cam Newton rushed for 14 TDs in 2011, the most ever by a QB in a season.

title: Sack King
fact: Michael Strahan set the single-season sack record (22.5) in 2001, aided by Brett Favre’s 'assist.'

title: Ironman RB
fact: Frank Gore rushed for over 1,000 yards at age 34, the oldest to do so.

title: Undefeated Regular Season
fact: The 2007 Patriots went 16-0 before losing Super Bowl XLII.

title: Turnaround Story
fact: The 1999 Rams went from 4-12 to Super Bowl champs ('The Greatest Show on Turf').

title: No Fly Zone
fact: The 2015 Broncos led the league in pass defense, key to their Super Bowl 50 win.

title: The Steel Curtain
fact: The 1976 Steelers defense allowed only 28 total points in their final nine games.

title: The Legion of Boom
fact: The 2013 Seahawks led the NFL in takeaways (39) and won the Super Bowl.

title: Late-Round Gem
fact: Shannon Sharpe was a 7th-round pick (192nd overall) in 1990 and became a Hall of Famer.

title: QB Bargain
fact: Russell Wilson was drafted in the 3rd round (75th overall) in 2012.

title: Steal of the Draft
fact: Richard Sherman was a 5th-round pick (154th overall) in 2011.

title: HOF Value
fact: Terrell Davis was a 6th-round pick (196th overall) in 1995.

title: Unexpected Star
fact: Antonio Brown was a 6th-round pick (195th overall) in 2010.

title: The Helmet Catch
fact: David Tyree’s improbable Super Bowl XLII catch helped the Giants upset the Patriots.

title: Beast Quake
fact: Marshawn Lynch’s 67-yard TD run in the 2010 playoffs caused seismic activity in Seattle.

title: Philly Special
fact: The Eagles ran a trick-play TD in Super Bowl LII with QB Nick Foles catching the pass.

title: Mile High Miracle
fact: Joe Flacco’s 70-yard TD to Jacoby Jones forced OT in a 2012 playoff win over Denver.

title: The Catch III
fact: Vernon Davis’ last-second TD catch in the 2011 playoffs beat the Saints.

title: The Tuck Rule Game
fact: A controversial call in 2002 helped the Patriots beat the Raiders in the playoffs.

title: The Fail Mary
fact: A 2012 game ended on a controversial TD catch by Golden Tate, replacement refs called it a score.

title: The Butt Fumble
fact: Mark Sanchez’s infamous play in 2012 became a symbol of Jets struggles.

title: 0-0 in OT
fact: The Lions and Giants played to the NFL’s first 0-0 tie in 1943.

title: The Hail Murray
fact: Kyler Murray’s last-second TD to DeAndre Hopkins beat the Bills in 2020.

title: Double Trouble
fact: DeAngelo Williams and Jonathan Stewart both rushed for 1,100+ yards for the 2009 Panthers.

title: No INTs
fact: Aaron Rodgers threw 28 TDs with only 5 INTs in his 2011 MVP season.

title: All-Purpose Beast
fact: Christian McCaffrey had 1,000+ rushing and receiving yards in 2019.

title: Undrafted Star
fact: Wes Welker led the NFL in receptions three times after going undrafted.

title: Kicker Longevity
fact: Adam Vinatieri played 24 seasons, retiring at age 46.

title: The Fumble & The Drive
fact: The Browns lost back-to-back AFC Championships in heartbreaking fashion (1986-87).

title: The No-Punt Game
fact: The 2014 Colts beat the Bengals without punting a single time.

title: Back-to-Back Shutouts
fact: The 1937 Bears shut out three straight opponents.

title: The Cardiac Cats
fact: The 2003 Panthers won seven games by 3 points or fewer.

title: Worst to First Turnaround
fact: The 2021 Bengals went from 4-11-1 to AFC Champs in one year.
